column2: He glanced at his watch, 6.18 p.m., and moved into first gear. He climbed off the bed, stripped off his clothes and threw them over a chair before going into the bathroom and taking a long shower.
It was at 18:18 when a sixty-one-year-old Tibetan woman telephoned for a fire engine to put out a burning car.
column3: My Name is Not Jacob Ramsay
